context: The word 'ostsid' is the second-person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'osta', which means 'to buy'. It is used when addressing one person informally and asking about or stating what they bought in the past. For example, 'Ostsid uue auto?' means 'Did you (singular) buy a new car?'. This form specifically indicates that the action of buying was completed by the person being addressed.
